Intensity: Medium The LORD reigns, He is robed in majesty; the LORD is robed, He has put on strength as His belt. Yes, the world is established; it cannot be moved.
Text: The verse expresses the sovereignty and majestic nature of God as ruler over all. Its emphasis on God’s reign and the stability of the world suggest a tone of confidence and celebration of divine kingship.

Intensity: Medium Your throne was established long ago; You are from all eternity.
Text: This verse emphasizes the eternal nature of God‘s dominion, suggesting that His rule is unchanging and everlasting. It assures readers of the ancient and secure foundation of God’s authority.

Intensity: Low  The floods have lifted up, O LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their pounding waves.
Text: The imagery of rising floods represents chaos and potential threat, contrasting the established order of God‘s reign with the turmoil found in nature or human circumstances.
Mightier than the thunders of many waters, mightier than the breakers of the sea—the LORD on high is mighty.
Context: This verse contrasts the previous depiction of chaos with God’s supreme power, asserting that even the most chaotic forces in nature cannot surpass God‘s strength and majesty.

Text: Your testimonies are fully confirmed; holiness adorns Your house, O LORD, for all the days to come.
Context: The verse concludes the psalm with a statement about the trustworthiness of God’s testimonies and the everlasting holiness of His dwelling, providing a sense of closure and peace as it reaffirms the eternal nature of God‘s reign and holiness.
